There are a lot of different methods you can use to prevent pregnancy. No one method is best for everyone. The best method for you is one that works and that you are most comfortable using.

What is most important to you?

  • How well it prevents pregnancy.
  • How comfortable and how easy it is to use.
  • How well it protects against STIs. (Condoms are the only family planning method that also protects against STIs, including HIV.)
  • If your partner is willing to use family planning, or if you must hide it from him.
  • If it is easy to get and how frequently you must use it.
  • How much it costs.
  • If it has side effects.

You might have other needs and concerns. For example: Will you be able to keep it private? If you have to go to a clinic regularly to get it, will the people there treat you respectfully? Are you breastfeeding? Do you have all the children you want? Do you never want children? Nobody knows what you want better than you.
